study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the radioprotective effects of melatonin on chromosomal damage and treatment outcomes in hyperthyroid patients treated with iodine-131.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in micronucleus formation between melatonin and placebo groups, but melatonin significantly improved treatment response rates (85.7% vs. 61.5%) at 6-month follow-up.
population_specificity: 52 female hyperthyroid patients referred to nuclear medicine centers in Babol, Iran.
effective_dosage: 10 to 20 mCi iodine-131 (single dose) and 300 mg melatonin (single dose).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of antiseptic solutions (including povidone-iodine) versus non-antiseptic solutions in reducing wound infection rates, bacterial load, and improving wound healing in acute traumatic wounds.
results_summary: Two studies showed significant reduction in wound infection rates with povidone-iodine (p=0.001 and p=0.03), while non-antiseptic solutions increased bacterial load (p=0.0001). The quality of evidence was very low, and no data on wound healing outcomes were reported.
population_specificity: Patients with simple, uncomplicated acute traumatic wounds (total 875 participants across four studies).

study_goal: To compare the diagnostic performance of iodine-enhanced multidetector CT and gadoxetic acid-enhanced 3.0 T MRI for detecting hepatocellular carcinoma.
results_summary: Gadoxetic acid-enhanced 3.0 T MRI showed superior diagnostic performance (higher true positives, true negatives, specificity, and negative clinical utility) compared to iodine-enhanced multidetector CT for detecting hepatocellular carcinoma. Sensitivity and accuracy were also higher for MRI (93.06% and 77.40%) than for CT (86.69% and 75.09%).
population_specificity: 815 patients at risk for hepatocellular carcinoma from two hospitals in China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of iodine-based skin preparation solutions (PI-Alc and PI-Aq) against chlorhexidine with alcohol (C-Alc) in preventing surgical site infections (SSIs).
results_summary: PI-Alc was non-inferior to C-Alc in preventing SSIs (10.88% vs. 11.09%), but not superior to PI-Aq (10.88% vs. 12.56%). No differences were observed in secondary outcomes, and no treatment-related adverse events or deaths occurred.
population_specificity: 3213 surgical patients (mean age 57, 55% female).
effective_dosage: Not specified (skin preparation solutions used preoperatively).
study_duration: Intervention duration not explicitly stated (study conducted from January 2015 to December 2018).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and image quality of 80-kV CTA protocols with varying iodine delivery rates and concentrations in non-obese patients, focusing on reducing radiation and contrast dose.
results_summary: The study found that 80-kV protocols with an iodine delivery rate of 1.2 gI/s maintained adequate contrast opacification and image quality while reducing radiation dose by 44-52% and iodine dose by 19% compared to standard protocols. Lower iodine delivery rates (0.96 gI/s) resulted in reduced opacification.
population_specificity: Non-obese patients (≤90 kg) aged ≥18 years referred for coronary or craniocervical CTA.
effective_dosage: 370 mgI/ml (IDR 1.48 gI/s, 1.2 gI/s) and 300 mgI/ml (IDR 1.2 gI/s, 0.96 gI/s).
study_duration: Data collected from July 2016 to July 2017 (exact intervention duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the molecular regulation and mechanisms of thyroid hormones, associated disorders, and potential treatment options, including iodine therapy.
results_summary: The study highlights that thyroid disorders are influenced by heredity and environmental factors, with iodine therapy (radioactive iodine) being a treatment option. Adjuvant antioxidant therapy may improve outcomes with anti-thyroid drugs.
population_specificity: General population (global epidemiology mentioned, including India, UK, and USA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of an iodine complex in reducing viral load and alleviating symptoms in mild to moderate COVID-19 patients.
results_summary: The study is designed to assess rapid viral load reduction, clinical and radiological improvement, lower mortality, and reduced hospitalization, but results are not yet provided in the abstract.
population_specificity: Mild to moderately symptomatic COVID-19 patients in Pakistan.
effective_dosage: 200 mg of elemental iodine in encapsulated, syrup, or throat spray forms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and compare guidelines on the diagnosis and management of thyroid disorders in pregnancy, including iodine nutrition recommendations.
results_summary: The study found consensus on diagnosing and managing overt thyroid disorders in pregnancy but noted controversy regarding subclinical thyroid disease and iodine nutrition recommendations. Radioactive iodine use is contraindicated during pregnancy and breastfeeding.
population_specificity: Pregnant women and those planning conception.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current and future therapies, including high specific activity iodine-131 metaiodobenzylguanidine, for treating metastatic pheochromocytomas and paragangliomas, focusing on efficacy and clinical guidance.
results_summary: High specific activity iodine-131 metaiodobenzylguanidine was approved for treating metastatic pheochromocytomas and paragangliomas expressing the noradrenaline transporter, with over 90% of patients showing clinical benefits. However, additional therapies are needed for broader patient coverage.
population_specificity: Patients aged ≥12 years with metastatic pheochromocytomas and paragangliomas expressing the noradrenaline transporter.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the characteristics and metastatic patterns of well-differentiated thyroid cancer in patients who underwent post-therapeutic iodine treatment.
results_summary: The study found that 64 metastatic lesions were analyzed, with bone being the most affected site (57.81%), followed by lung (17.19%). The majority of lesions had papillary histology (67.19%), while 32.81% were follicular type.
population_specificity: Ten patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (80% women, 20% men; mean age 58 ± 11.6 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent molecular therapies, including tyrosine kinase inhibitors and immune checkpoint inhibitors, for treating iodine-refractory thyroid cancers (RAI-TC).
results_summary: The study found that drugs like sorafenib, lenvatinib, and immune checkpoint inhibitors show promise in treating RAI-TC, with some therapies re-inducing iodine uptake in BRAF-mutated cases. Resistance mechanisms to TKIs were noted, and combination therapies (e.g., lenvatinib and pembrolizumab) are under investigation.
population_specificity: Patients with aggressive iodine-refractory thyroid cancers (RAI-TC) derived from follicular cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of different low iodine diet (LID) durations (1-week, 2-week, or no advice) before radioiodine remnant ablation (RRA) in patients with differentiated thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in ablation success rates between 1-week and 2-week LID groups, with excellent response rates of 48%, 36%, and 49% for C1, C2, and C3, respectively. The adjusted odds ratio for excellent response at C2 vs C1 was 0.57 (95%CI: 0.25,1.32), indicating no clear advantage for a longer LID.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer treated with RRA in the UK.
effective_dosage: Not specified (focus was on LID duration, not iodine dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to observe dietary changes, including iodine intake, in type 2 diabetes patients following a lifestyle intervention program over 12 months.
results_summary: The study found a lower intake of iodine in participants at 6 and 12 months compared to baseline, raising concerns about potential deficiencies. No specific health outcomes related to iodine were reported.
population_specificity: 147 type 2 diabetes patients (cross-sectional) and 22 participants (prospective).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the reasons for the low utilization of surgery in treating Graves' disease (GD) and to reassess its benefit-to-harm ratio compared to antithyroid drugs (ATD) and radioactive iodine (RAI).
results_summary: The abstract highlights that thyroidectomy has the highest success rates for GD but is underutilized, suggesting a need to reconsider surgical referrals based on updated evidence. It also notes advancements in surgical techniques that may improve safety and outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' disease (primary or persistent).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the historical and current use of radioactive iodine (I-131) in treating thyroid diseases and neuroendocrine tumors, focusing on personalized treatment planning and dosimetry.
results_summary: The study found that radioactive iodine has been effectively used for decades in treating thyroid cancer and neuroendocrine tumors, with individualized treatment plans improving efficacy by maximizing target radiation doses while minimizing risks to organs-at-risk. However, fixed-activity approaches resulted in widely varying absorbed doses, highlighting the need for personalized dosimetry.
population_specificity: Adults and pediatric patients with thyroid diseases and neuroendocrine tumors.
effective_dosage: Not specified (varies based on empirical or dosimetry-guided approaches).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the usefulness of dual-energy CT in improving lesion visualization and detectability through iodine contrast and material decomposition techniques.
results_summary: The study found that dual-energy CT enhances iodine contrast at lower energy levels, improving visualization of contrast-enhanced lesions, and material decomposition (e.g., iodine images) increases lesion detectability in clinical practice.
population_specificity: Not specified (general clinical practice context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the clinical characteristics of contrast media-induced Kounis syndrome (KS), focusing on iodine-containing contrast media.
results_summary: The study found that iodine-containing contrast media were associated with KS in 12 cases, primarily manifesting as chest pain and allergic reactions within 30 minutes of administration. Most patients recovered with treatment, but two fatalities occurred.
population_specificity: 26 patients (19 men, 7 women) with a median age of 60 years (range 30-83).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current evidence and recommendations for the evaluation and management of thyroid disorders, including iodine deficiency, in pregnancy and postpartum.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that iodine deficiency is the leading cause of hypothyroidism worldwide and that pregnant women remain at risk due to increased iodine requirements. It also discusses the challenges of managing thyroid disorders during pregnancy and postpartum.
population_specificity: Pregnant women and postpartum individuals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the clinical, hormonal-metabolic, and structural effects of radiation exposure on parathyroid function in survivors of the Chornobyl NPP accident, including its connection to endocrine disorders.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in carbohydrate metabolic disorders among exposed groups with parathyroid hyperplasia compared to controls, but noted higher parathyroid hormone levels and vitamin D deficiency in exposed individuals. A strong association was observed between vitamin D deficiency and thyroid disease, metabolic disorders, cardiovascular disease, and bone health issues.
population_specificity: Survivors of the Chornobyl NPP accident (n=224), their descendants (n=146), and a general population control group (n=70).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of recombinant human thyrotropin (rhTSH)-aided radioiodine treatment compared to radioiodine alone for non-toxic multinodular goitre.
results_summary: RhTSH-aided radioiodine treatment increased the risk of hypothyroidism but led to a greater reduction in thyroid volume compared to radioiodine alone. Adverse events were more common with rhTSH-aided therapy, but the evidence on quality of life and costs was sparse or missing.
population_specificity: Women with non-toxic multinodular goitre.
effective_dosage: A single dose of radioiodine administered 24 hours after a single intramuscular injection of rhTSH (specific amounts not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical outcomes of Lugol's iodine staining (LIS) and narrow-band imaging (NBI) for demarcating early esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (EESCCs) during endoscopic submucosal dissection.
results_summary: NBI showed comparable accuracy to LIS for demarcating EESCCs, with shorter procedure time, reduced use of scopolamine butylbromide, fewer clips used, and less post-operative discomfort. No significant differences were found in R0 resection rate, adverse events, recurrence rate, or survival outcomes between the two methods.
population_specificity: 172 patients with early esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (109 in the LIS group, 63 in the NBI group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of povidone-iodine (PVI) compared to chlorhexidine (CHX) for preventing surgical site infections in upper limb surgery.
results_summary: For elective upper limb surgery, aqueous PVI was less effective than alcoholic CHX in reducing SSI risk. In emergency surgery, aqueous PVI appeared least effective, but results were uncertain. No adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: Adults and children undergoing upper limb surgery distal to the shoulder joint.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test whether povidone-iodine mouthwash reduces SARS-CoV-2 salivary viral load in COVID-19 patients.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant reduction in salivary viral load after using povidone-iodine mouthwash, suggesting it may not be effective in vivo despite in vitro virucidal effects.
population_specificity: COVID-19 patients (84 participants, divided into groups of 12-15).
study_duration: Single use, with measurements at baseline and 30, 60, and 120 minutes post-rinse.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy and safety of povidone iodine as a treatment for prolonged parenchymal air-leak following various types of lung surgery.
results_summary: Povidone iodine significantly reduced the mean drainage period (9.21 days vs. 15.62 days in the control group) and was associated with a low complication rate, demonstrating effectiveness and safety for pleurodesis.
population_specificity: Patients with prolonged parenchymal air-leak following lung surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate radiologic criteria for pseudoprogression (PsPD) after front-line radiation therapy (RT) in pediatric low-grade glioma (LGG) and investigate its frequency and duration across different RT modalities.
results_summary: The study found that PsPD occurred in 39.7% of patients, with no significant differences between RT modalities. PsPD typically appeared around 6.3 months post-RT and persisted for a median of 7.2 months, with necrosis within the tumor-associated T2 lesion being a significant predictor.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with low-grade glioma (median age 11.3 years, range 0.8-25.9).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the risks and dosimetric implications of unintended radiation exposure in nuclear medicine, particularly focusing on PET imaging and radiopharmaceutical administration.
results_summary: The study highlights that unintended exposures in nuclear medicine, especially in PET imaging, can lead to small but measurable increases in radiation risk for staff, with doses ranging from 1-25 µSv/GBq, primarily during injection. Preparation and administration of radiopharmaceuticals pose significant hand exposure risks, challenging dose limits for certain radionuclides.
population_specificity: Nuclear medicine staff and patients undergoing PET imaging.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of povidone-iodine in alcohol versus aqueous solution and chlorhexidine in alcohol for preventing surgical site infections in colorectal surgery.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in surgical site infection rates among the three skin preparation groups (povidone-iodine in alcohol, aqueous povidone-iodine, and chlorhexidine in alcohol), with infection rates of 22.8%, 23.0%, and 20.6%, respectively. Complication rates and length of hospital stay were also similar across all groups.
population_specificity: Adults undergoing colorectal surgery at two hospitals in New South Wales, Australia.
effective_dosage: Povidone-iodine in 70% alcohol or aqueous solution (specific concentration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of apatinib, a VEGFR-2 inhibitor, in patients with progressive locally advanced or metastatic radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (RAIR-DTC).
results_summary: Apatinib significantly improved progression-free survival (22.2 months vs. 4.5 months for placebo) and overall survival, with a high objective response rate (54.3%) and disease control rate (95.7%). Common adverse events included hypertension, hand-foot syndrome, proteinuria, and diarrhea, but the safety profile was deemed manageable.
population_specificity: Patients with progressive locally advanced or metastatic RAIR-DTC (mean age 55.7 years; 60.9% women).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of nasal povidone-iodine (PVI) compared with standard care in reducing infections among haemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding iodine's effects, as the study is described as ongoing or not yet completed.
population_specificity: Outpatient haemodialysis patients
study_duration: 3-year trial period with a 4-month baseline and eight 4-month time blocks

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the side effects and risks of iodine-131 and other radiopharmaceuticals used in nuclear theragnostic approaches for treating thyroid cancer and other neoplasms.
results_summary: The study found that iodine-131 has been used effectively for diagnostic imaging and therapy in thyroid cancer for over 75 years, with generally minimal and manageable adverse effects. The theragnostic approach shows significant clinical results but carries potential off-target risks.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid cancer, neuroendocrine neoplasms, adrenergic tumors, metastatic prostate cancer, and liver tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the follow-up of infants born to mothers with Graves Disease (GD) to assess the risk and management of neonatal hyperthyroidism (NH).
results_summary: The study found that 87% of newborns were high-risk for NH, with 22% evaluated for thyroid function on day 1; one case of hyperthyroidism was identified. A significant delay in obtaining high-risk group results was noted, suggesting the need for standardized protocols to reduce unnecessary consultations.
population_specificity: Newborns born to mothers with Graves Disease at a Tertiary Hospital.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of ozonated olive oil lotion compared to permethrin shampoo in treating head pediculosis.
results_summary: The ozonated olive oil lotion showed a sharp decline in iodine index (81.8±1.28 to 0 g iodine per 100 g) and cured all patients within one week, outperforming permethrin shampoo.
population_specificity: 121 patients with proven head pediculosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and validate a dual-energy CT-based radiomics nomogram using iodine-based material decomposition images to predict the histological differentiation of head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
results_summary: The study found that the nomogram combining tumor location and radiomics signatures from iodine-based images showed high predictive performance (AUC = 0.987 in training, 0.968 in validation) for differentiating HNSCC grades. The iodine-based signature was a significant predictor of tumor differentiation.
population_specificity: 178 patients with histologically proven head and neck squamous cell carcinoma from eight institutions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of replacing animal proteins with plant proteins on iodine intake and status in healthy adults.
results_summary: Iodine intake and status were significantly lower in groups with higher plant protein intake (50/50 and PLANT) compared to the ANIMAL group. The study highlights a potential risk of inadequate iodine intake when shifting towards plant-based diets.
population_specificity: Healthy adults aged 20-69 years (107 female, 29 male).
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary protein intake designed at 17 E%).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the safety, dose-limiting toxicity, and efficacy of high-dose iodine-131-meta-iodobenzylguanidine therapy for high-risk neuroblastoma in pediatric patients.
results_summary: The study enrolled eight patients, all of whom experienced adverse events/reactions, but no dose-limiting toxicities were observed. The therapy showed some efficacy, though specific outcomes were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with high-risk neuroblastoma (six females; median age 4 years; six newly diagnosed and two relapsed cases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the toxicity, safety, and treatment options for sorafenib, lenvatinib, and cabozantinib in RAI-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), with a focus on treatment-emergent hypertension.
results_summary: The study found that sorafenib, lenvatinib, and cabozantinib improve progression-free and overall survival in RAI-refractory DTC, though they cause manageable treatment-emergent hypertension, with lenvatinib being the preferred first-line option despite higher hypertension rates.
population_specificity: Patients with radioactive iodine (RAI)-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review risk factors for Graves' ophthalmopathy (GO), including the role of radioactive iodine in inducing hyperthyroidism and increasing GO occurrence.
results_summary: Radioactive iodine on the thyroid may induce hyperthyroidism and increase the occurrence of GO. The study did not focus on iodine's therapeutic effects but highlighted its potential adverse role in GO development.
population_specificity: Individuals with or at risk for Graves' ophthalmopathy (GO).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms behind iodixanol-induced delayed cutaneous adverse reactions and explore potential anti-allergic interventions.
results_summary: Iodixanol caused systemic anaphylaxis, plasma protein extravasation, mast cell degranulation, and increased inflammatory markers. Trigonelline showed anti-allergic effects by inhibiting these pseudo-allergic reactions.
population_specificity: Mice with positive allergic reactions

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify factors associated with tumor recurrence in patients with papillary thyroid cancer (PTC) treated with radioactive iodine (I-131).
results_summary: The study found that patients in early TNM stages had a lower recurrence rate (7.2%) compared to advanced stages (28.2%). Key factors influencing recurrence included distant metastasis, lymph node metastasis, male gender, surgical method, and serum thyroglobulin levels.
population_specificity: 829 patients with papillary thyroid cancer (PTC), grouped into early (stage I and II) and advanced (stage III and IV) TNM stages.
effective_dosage: Accumulated radioactive iodine (I-131) therapeutic dose (specific amounts not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy for differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) increases the risk of primary breast cancer.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found no increased risk of primary breast cancer in DTC patients treated with RAI compared to those not treated, with a pooled relative risk of 0.83 (95% CI: 0.70-0.99). The results suggest RAI therapy does not elevate breast cancer risk.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), including 98,368 treated with RAI and 101,879 not treated with RAI.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antimicrobial efficacy of 10% Betadine (povidone-iodine) and 0.2% chlorhexidine for perioral skin disinfection before oral surgical procedures.
results_summary: The study found that both 10% Betadine and 0.2% chlorhexidine significantly reduced bacterial colony counts, but chlorhexidine was more effective. The difference in efficacy between the two antiseptics was statistically significant.
population_specificity: 57 male patients presenting to the Periodontology Department of Ahvaz Jundishapur University.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the pathological features of papillary thyroid carcinoma in patients exposed to post-Chernobyl radiation who developed second primary malignancies, and assess the potential influence of radioactive iodine treatment on second primary malignancies.
results_summary: The study found that patients with second primary malignancies had less biologically aggressive thyroid cancers and were less frequently treated with post-surgical radioactive iodine, suggesting 131I-irradiation may have negligible impact on second primary malignancies. No significant differences in tumor extension or histological features were noted between synchronous and metachronous second primary malignancies.
population_specificity: Patients exposed to radiation at ≤18 years old who developed papillary thyroid carcinoma between 1990-2020 (n=6559, with 140 having second primary malignancies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of povidone-iodine (PVP-I) nasal sprays on nasopharyngeal viral load and symptom improvement in COVID-19-positive outpatients.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in viral load reduction between PVP-I and placebo groups, though the 2.0% PVP-I group showed symptom improvement but also reported nasal burning. All groups showed improved olfaction over 30 days.
population_specificity: COVID-19-positive outpatients within 5 days of diagnosis.
effective_dosage: 0.5% PVP-I and 2.0% PVP-I nasal sprays (two sprays/nostril at baseline, 20 sprays/nostril over 3 days).
study_duration: 3 days of active intervention, with follow-up to 30 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of 10% aqueous povidone-iodine versus 2% alcoholic chlorhexidine in preventing surgical site infections (SSIs) in low-resource settings.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in SSI rates between povidone-iodine and chlorhexidine, nor between triclosan-coated and non-coated sutures. Both interventions showed similar efficacy in preventing SSIs across clean-contaminated and contaminated/dirty surgical wounds.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing abdominal surgery with a skin incision ≥5 cm in low-income and middle-income countries (Benin, Ghana, India, Mexico, Nigeria, Rwanda, South Africa).
study_duration: Single preoperative application (follow-up duration not specified in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the prevalence and awareness of hypothyroidism, particularly undiagnosed cases, and its association with dietary iodine availability, gender, and age.
results_summary: The study found that 4-7% of community-derived populations in the USA and Europe have undiagnosed hypothyroidism, with most cases being subclinical. Prevalence was higher in older subjects, women, and certain ethnic groups.
population_specificity: Community-derived populations in the USA and Europe, with a focus on older subjects, women, and specific ethnic groups.

study_goal: The researchers were examining the toxicity and regulatory concerns of iodinated disinfection byproducts (I-DBPs) in water treatment.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the high toxicity of I-DBPs, particularly iodinated trihalomethanes (I-THMs), and mentions regulatory considerations in Shenzhen, China.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on water treatment byproducts).

study_goal: To evaluate the efficacy of povidone-iodine formulations as a virucidal agent against SARS-CoV-2 on skin and mucous membranes.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine formulations were found to provide effective virucidal action against SARS-CoV-2 on biological surfaces, such as skin and mucous membranes. The study highlights its utility in disinfection methods to reduce viral transmission.
population_specificity: Not specified (general application for disinfection purposes)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of saline, rifampicin, and povidone-iodine irrigation on preventing incisional surgical site infections after caesarean section.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in surgical site infection rates between the groups using rifampicin or povidone-iodine compared to saline alone.
population_specificity: 300 patients scheduled for caesarean section.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the adherence to 2012 Chinese DTC guidelines in the initial management of patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) and evaluate treatment outcomes, including the use of radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy.
results_summary: The study found that 93.1% of patients underwent standard surgery, 99.0% had lymph node dissection, and 48.8% received RAI therapy. At 1-year follow-up, 34.6% achieved an excellent response, but 10.4% experienced adverse events, mostly mild.
population_specificity: Patients with intermediate or high-risk differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) after first-time thyroidectomy in China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify prognostic factors, including stimulated thyroglobulin (sTg) levels and treatment response, associated with outcomes in pediatric patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC) after radioactive iodine therapy (RAIT).
results_summary: One year after RAIT, 53% of pediatric DTC patients showed an excellent response, while 33% had an incomplete response. Higher sTg levels (>27.2 ng/ml) predicted poorer treatment response, and 1-year response was strongly associated with long-term disease status (87% no evidence of disease after median 133-month follow-up).
population_specificity: Pediatric patients (≤18 years) with differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether dietary iodine supplementation affects thyroid function in preterm infants during the neonatal period and its impact on neurodevelopmental outcomes.
results_summary: Iodine supplementation helped preterm infants reach recommended iodine levels early, influencing thyroid hormone levels, but did not significantly affect Bayley-III composite scores. However, low iodine excretion in the first 4 weeks was linked to potential effects on language development.
population_specificity: Very low birth weight preterm infants (under 1500 g) in a Spanish university hospital.
study_duration: From the first day of life until hospital discharge.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic and therapeutic approaches for pediatric Graves disease, including the use of radioactive iodine therapy.
results_summary: The study highlights that antithyroid drugs are first-line treatment but often insufficient for sustained remission in pediatric patients, necessitating definitive treatments like radioactive iodine or surgery. It emphasizes the need for a multidisciplinary approach involving various pediatric specialists.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with Graves disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of mouth rinses, particularly those containing povidone iodine, in reducing viral loads, specifically SARS-CoV-2, in the oral and pharyngeal mucosa.
results_summary: The study found that mouth rinses with povidone iodine and chlorhexidine transiently reduced viral loads, though large-scale RCTs are needed to confirm efficacy.
population_specificity: Individuals using mouth rinses to reduce viral loads, particularly SARS-CoV-2.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the association between insurance status and the appropriateness of therapy (including radioactive iodine treatment) in differentiated thyroid cancer patients.
results_summary: Medicaid and uninsured patients were more likely to receive inappropriate therapy (e.g., inappropriate lobectomy or under-treatment with radioactive iodine), which was associated with decreased survival. Appropriate surgical resection improved survival odds. No difference in treatment appropriateness was observed between Medicaid expansion and non-expansion states.
population_specificity: Differentiated thyroid cancer patients diagnosed between 2010 and 2016 in the U.S.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the frequency of thyroid cancer in the DRC and analyze associated epidemiological, clinical, and ultrasound risk factors, including iodine deficiency.
results_summary: The study found a 20% frequency of thyroid cancer in the cohort, primarily in patients over 40, with papillary cancer being the most common. The histopathology distribution differed from developed countries, with a higher prevalence of anaplastic cancer, potentially linked to iodine deficiency.
population_specificity: 594 patients operated on for a thyroid mass in the DRC from 2005 to 2019.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety of radioactive iodine (I-131) in treating hyperthyroidism, particularly its potential association with increased cancer risk.
results_summary: The study found that radioactive iodine was associated with an increased risk of mortality from overall cancer, breast cancer, and non-breast solid cancers, contradicting earlier reassuring evidence. The 2019 re-analysis of the CTTFUS cohort extended follow-up and used a novel dosimetric model to reach these conclusions.
population_specificity: Patients with hyperthyroidism secondary to Graves disease and autonomously functioning thyroid nodules.
study_duration: Extended follow-up beyond the original 1998 study

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate long-term male fertility after radioactive iodine (RAI) treatment for differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC) and compare semen quality before and after RAI.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in semen quality parameters (volume, concentration, progressive motility, total motile sperm count) between participants and the general population, suggesting normal long-term semen quality after RAI. Cryopreservation of semen was rarely used, indicating it may not be crucial for conception post-RAI.
population_specificity: Males with DTC who received a cumulative RAI activity of ≥3.7 GBq, evaluated ≥2 years after their final treatment.
effective_dosage: Median cumulative administered activity of RAI was 7.4 GBq (range: 3.7-23.3 GBq).
study_duration: Median follow-up of 5.8 years after last RAI administration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of 0.5% povidone-iodine as a mouthrinse in reducing SARS-CoV-2 viral load in saliva.
results_summary: The study found that 0.5% povidone-iodine, along with other mouthrinses, significantly reduced viral load by 61%-89% at 15 minutes and 70%-97% at 45 minutes, with efficacy correlating with initial viral load.
population_specificity: Symptomatic, asymptomatic, presymptomatic, and postsymptomatic individuals infected with SARS-CoV-2.
study_duration: Immediate effects measured at 15 and 45 minutes post-rinse.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of intrawound treatments, including povidone-iodine (PI), in preventing surgical site infections (SSI) after spine surgery.
results_summary: The study found that povidone-iodine (PI) was the most efficacious intrawound treatment for reducing SSI, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.10 (95% CI, 0.04-0.23), significantly outperforming other treatments like vancomycin and hydrogen peroxide.
population_specificity: Adult and pediatric patients undergoing spine surgery, including those with tumors, congenital diseases, or degenerative conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of diluted povidone-iodine (PI) lavage in preventing periprosthetic joint infection (PJI) in primary and revision surgery.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that PI lavage was significantly better than saline solution for preventing PJI, with an odds ratio of 0.33 (95% CI, 0.16-0.71) in studies with a saline control group. However, overall results were inconclusive when compared to ununified control groups.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing primary and revision joint surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the aetiology, prevention, and therapy of radiation-induced hypothyroidism, focusing on iodine thyroid blocking (ITB) as a countermeasure.
results_summary: The study found that iodine thyroid blocking (ITB) is effective in reducing thyroid absorbed doses during nuclear emergencies, with 100 mg iodide providing ~90% protection after 1 day. However, delayed administration significantly reduces efficacy, and repeated exposure requires daily 50 mg iodide doses.
population_specificity: Children, adolescents, and adults exposed to radiation (e.g., Chernobyl accident victims, radiotherapy patients).
effective_dosage: 100 mg iodide (single dose for acute exposure), 50 mg iodide daily (repeated exposure).
study_duration: Varies (single dose up to repeated daily administration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to estimate the prevalence of insufficient iodine intake in pregnant women across different regions of the world.
results_summary: The study found an overall prevalence of insufficient iodine intake of 53% among pregnant women, indicating that salt iodination alone may not be sufficient to ensure adequate iodine status in this population. The findings suggest additional actions may be needed to improve iodine nutrition in pregnant women.
population_specificity: Pregnant women (adults and adolescents) from various global regions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of alcoholic chlorhexidine and povidone iodine in reducing bacterial skin colonization during preoperative skin preparation for clean orthopedic surgery.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that chlorhexidine was significantly more effective than povidone iodine in reducing bacterial skin flora, with a lower positive culture rate (RR = 0.53, 95% CI: 0.32-0.88).
population_specificity: Patients undergoing clean orthopedic surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical applications and benefits of dual-energy CT (DECT) imaging, particularly its ability to quantify iodine enhancement in lung parenchyma for assessing pulmonary vascular diseases.
results_summary: The study found that dual-energy CTPA improves pulmonary emboli detection, diagnostic confidence, and severity stratification, while also offering utility in assessing pulmonary hypertension, particularly in chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension patients.
population_specificity: Patients with acute and chronic pulmonary vascular conditions, including those with pulmonary hypertension.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to assess the efficacy of hyaluronic acid (HA) in managing recurrent aphthous stomatitis (RAS), comparing it to various treatments including iodine glycerin.
results_summary: The study found that HA showed good efficacy in alleviating pain and shortening healing time in RAS patients, with no reported side effects. Iodine glycerin was one of the comparative treatments, but its specific efficacy relative to HA was not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: 538 patients with recurrent aphthous stomatitis (RAS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the principles and clinical applications of dual-energy CT, particularly its ability to improve iodine quantification and contrast enhancement in neurological evaluations.
results_summary: The study found that dual-energy CT enables better iodine quantification, improved conspicuity of iodinated contrast enhancement, and advanced material decomposition compared to conventional single-energy CT, often at comparable or lower radiation doses.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of dual-energy CT applications, likely including diverse patient populations).
study_duration: Not applicable (review article, not an intervention study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a 4-day low-iodine diet (LID) was sufficient for adequate iodine depletion in preparation for 131I therapy in differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) patients and evaluated the nutritional impact of the LID.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in 24-hour urinary iodine excretion (UIE) between days 4 and 7 of the LID, with 72.1% of patients adequately prepared by day 4. Nutritional intake was significantly lower during the LID compared to regular diets.
population_specificity: 65 DTC patients treated at two university medical centers between 2018 and 2021.
effective_dosage: Not specified (focus on dietary iodine restriction).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the multifactorial etiology of Hashimoto's thyroiditis (HT), including the role of iodine supply as an environmental trigger for immune modulation.
results_summary: The abstract mentions iodine as one of the environmental factors influencing immune modulation and HT development but does not provide specific results on iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with Hashimoto's thyroiditis (HT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy for hyperthyroidism increases cancer risk and to assess dose-response associations.
results_summary: The study found no significant overall increase in cancer incidence or mortality from RAI therapy, except for elevated thyroid cancer risk. A dose-response association was observed for breast and solid cancer mortality at higher RAI doses.
population_specificity: Patients treated for hyperthyroidism with RAI (479,452 participants across 12 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the real-time uptake of radioactive iodine (RAI) in patients with hyperthyroid Graves' disease and thyroid cancer using the Collar Therapy Indicator (COTI).
results_summary: The study found that RAI therapy is effective in 80-90% of thyroid cancer patients for remnant ablation and can induce remission in nonresectable metastatic disease, though precise tumor dosing remains challenging. The COTI device successfully measured cervical RAI exposure, correlating well with conventional methods.
population_specificity: Patients with hyperthyroid Graves' disease and thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 5% povidone-iodine, used as a disinfectant in tympanoplasty, adversely affects patients' hearing.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in bone conduction levels between the intervention and control groups at various frequencies, indicating that 5% povidone-iodine did not affect hearing. The results suggest it is safe for use in otologic surgeries.
population_specificity: Chronic otitis media patients undergoing tympanoplasty.
effective_dosage: 5% povidone-iodine solution applied to the external auditory canal for 10 minutes.
study_duration: 10 minutes during surgery, with follow-up measurements one month post-exposure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the evidence for the use of iodine (povidone-iodine) as an adjunct antiseptic wash in treating periprosthetic joint infections, focusing on its mechanism of action and effectiveness.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that povidone-iodine is among the antiseptic agents used off-label to reduce bacterial bioburden and remove biofilm in periprosthetic joint infections, though some combinations may cause tissue toxicity. The review evaluates its mechanism of action and evidence for use.
population_specificity: Patients with periprosthetic joint infections (specifically after total hip or knee arthroplasty).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and appropriate use of iodine-125 in low dose rate (LDR) brachytherapy for treating prostate cancer.
results_summary: Iodine-125 was found to be an effective radionuclide for LDR brachytherapy, with symptom resolution typically occurring within a year. Urinary symptoms peaked early but could be managed with alpha blockers.
population_specificity: Patients with low-risk, favorable intermediate-risk, unfavorable intermediate-risk, and high-risk prostate cancer.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dose based on clinical application).
study_duration: Follow-up included symptom resolution timelines (median 1 year for iodine-125).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the optimal treatment strategies for congenital chylothorax (CCT), including the potential use of povidone-iodine for postnatal pleurodesis.
results_summary: The study found that povidone-iodine might be considered for postnatal pleurodesis in life-threatening CCT cases, though its efficacy was not directly compared to other treatments. The overall success rate for surgical interventions was 69%, but iodine-specific outcomes were not detailed.
population_specificity: Newborns with congenital chylothorax (CCT), including preterm infants (71%) and those with associated congenital anomalies or chromosomal aberrations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the literature on neonatal isolated hyperthyrotropinemia (HTT), focusing on prevalence, management, etiology, and outcomes, including the role of iodine levels.
results_summary: The study found that excessive or insufficient iodine levels were present in 46% and 16% of infants with HTT, respectively, suggesting a link between iodine imbalance and thyroid dysfunction. Genetic and environmental factors also contributed to the spectrum of thyroid impairment severity.
population_specificity: Neonates with isolated hyperthyrotropinemia (HTT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide an overview of quantitative clinical applications of dual-energy CT (DECT) in the abdomen and pelvis, including investigational uses.
results_summary: The study highlights improvements in CT image contrast, noise reduction, and artifact reduction due to DECT technology, enhancing radiologists' ability to detect and characterize abdominal pathologies. Several applications remain investigational but are important for future clinical implementation.
population_specificity: Not specified (general radiology applications in abdomen and pelvis)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of 1% Povidone-iodine as a preprocedural mouthwash in reducing salivary SARS-CoV-2 viral load compared to a control and Chlorhexidine.
results_summary: The study found that 1% Povidone-iodine significantly reduced SARS-CoV-2 viral load in saliva, with no significant difference in efficacy compared to Chlorhexidine 0.2%. Both solutions outperformed the control (distilled water).
population_specificity: Laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 positive patients (n=61, 36 female, 25 male, mean age 45.3 ± 16.7 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to study the impact of genetic and non-genetic factors, including iodine, on warfarin dosing in a Chinese Han population.
results_summary: The study found that iodine (amine-iodine) had a minor but statistically significant effect on warfarin initial dose prediction, with a coefficient of -0.036 in the model.
population_specificity: Chinese Han population taking warfarin
interactions: Warfarin (mentioned in the context of dosing interactions)

study_goal: The researchers examined the clinical challenges of managing a rare case of TSH/GH-secreting pituitary adenoma with coexisting papillary thyroid cancer, including the role of radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy.
results_summary: The study found that radioactive iodine therapy was needed for thyroid cancer but was complicated by uncontrolled TSH levels due to the pituitary adenoma, leading to treatment resistance and tumor growth.
population_specificity: A 59-year-old man with TSH/GH-secreting pituitary adenoma and multifocal papillary thyroid microcarcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential clinical applications of dual-energy CT (DECT) in diagnosing and risk-stratifying pulmonary embolism (PE).
results_summary: The abstract highlights that DECT combines the advantages of multidetector computed tomography (MDCT) with functional information, suggesting its utility in PE diagnosis and risk stratification. However, no specific results regarding iodine's effects are mentioned.
population_specificity: Patients with pulmonary embolism (PE).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of different chlorhexidine mouthwashes with anti-discoloration systems (SPDD and ADS) in reducing plaque and improving gingival health.
results_summary: All tested mouthwashes showed good efficacy in plaque reduction. The 0.20% chlorhexidine concentration slightly outperformed the 0.12% concentration in plaque index (PI) and bleeding index (BI) parameters. The SPDD system improved taste and reduced discoloration.
population_specificity: 84 patients in a single-center study.
effective_dosage: 0.12% and 0.20% chlorhexidine mouthwashes, alcohol-free, with SPDD or ADS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of iodine (specifically povidone-iodine) in wound irrigation for improving healing outcomes and reducing infection rates.
results_summary: The study found that povidone-iodine was effective in reducing surgical-site infection rates when used for intraoperative irrigation and was recommended for infected wounds and breast implant wounds.
population_specificity: Patients with acute soft-tissue wounds, complex wounds, infected wounds, breast implant wounds, and surgical-site infections.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of a bundled care program, including iodine-based strategies, for preventing surgical-site infections (SSIs) and periprosthetic joint infections (PJIs) in lower extremity total joint arthroplasty (TJA).
results_summary: The study suggests that iodine-based strategies (povidone-iodine skin preparation, iodine-alcohol surgical prepping, and iodophor-impregnated drapes) are important components of SSI-prevention protocols, with potential synergistic effects when combined with other mitigation strategies.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing lower extremity total joint arthroplasty (TJA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the risk of thyroid storm in hyperthyroid patients undergoing surgery, comparing different preoperative treatments including iodine.
results_summary: The study found cases of thyroid storm in all treatment groups, including iodine, with incidences ranging from 0% to 14%. The evidence was deemed insufficient to conclusively determine the risk of thyroid storm for any specific treatment.
population_specificity: Adult hyperthyroid patients undergoing elective thyroidectomy under general anesthesia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop consensus recommendations for the diagnosis and management of radioactive iodine-resistant differentiated thyroid cancer (RAIRTC).
results_summary: The study produced multidisciplinary guidance for managing RAIRTC, recognizing its rarity and heterogeneous clinical behavior, and highlighted potential limitations in access to effective therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with radioactive iodine-resistant differentiated thyroid cancer (RAIRTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of chlorhexidine-alcohol and povidone-iodine as preoperative antiseptic skin preparations for preventing surgical site infections after cesarean delivery.
results_summary: The study found that chlorhexidine-alcohol resulted in a lower SSI rate (5.4%) compared to povidone-iodine (8.6%), though the difference was not statistically significant. E. coli, K. pneumoniae, and Acinetobacter baumannii were the most common pathogens isolated.
population_specificity: 311 women undergoing cesarean delivery.
effective_dosage: Not specified (used as preoperative antiseptic skin preparation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize studies on health-related quality of life (HRQOL) outcomes following diagnosis and treatment of thyroid cancer, including the impact of radio-iodine.
results_summary: The review identified an increasing number of publications on HRQOL in thyroid cancer patients, with many focusing on the impact of radio-iodine, but noted gaps in research on surgical aspects and long-term HRQOL interventions.
population_specificity: Thyroid cancer patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether vitamin C solution (VCS) could reduce adverse reactions caused by Lugol iodine solution (LIS) during chromoendoscopy for esophageal cancer screening.
results_summary: VCS significantly reduced acute adverse reactions from 1.2% LIS and heartburn from 0.5% LIS, performing similarly to sodium thiosulfate solution (STS) and better than distilled water (DW). VCS also caused rapid decolorization of iodine-stained mucosa, fading by 90% within 120 seconds.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing Lugol chromoendoscopy in four Chinese hospitals (1610 in the 1.2% LIS group, 1355 in the 0.5% LIS group, plus 150 for discoloration assessment).
effective_dosage: 1.2% and 0.5% Lugol iodine solution (LIS), with VCS, STS, or DW sprayed post-staining.
study_duration: Immediate effects (acute reactions) and up to 1 week (heartburn).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adjuvant radioactive iodine improves overall survival in patients with aggressive variants of papillary thyroid cancer (tall cell and diffuse sclerosing) compared to classic papillary thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The study found no overall survival advantage from adjuvant radioactive iodine for aggressive tumor variants ≤2 cm treated with total thyroidectomy, but improved survival was observed for tumors 21-40 mm when radioactive iodine was added.
population_specificity: Patients ≥18 years with classic papillary thyroid cancer, tall cell, or diffuse sclerosing variants (1 mm to 40 mm).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term outcomes and treatment efficacy of radioactive iodine therapy in a rare case of Hurthle cell thyroid carcinoma with unusual multisite metastases.
results_summary: The study found that radioactive iodine therapy, combined with surgical metastasectomy, enabled long-term survival in a patient with recurrent Hurthle cell thyroid carcinoma and unusual metastases. The case demonstrated that aggressive treatment and consistent aftercare can lead to favorable outcomes despite the disease's aggressive nature.
population_specificity: A 63-year-old Caucasian female with Hurthle cell thyroid carcinoma and unusual multisite metastases.
effective_dosage: Two courses of radioactive iodine therapy (specific dosage not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of radiofrequency ablation (RFA) as an alternative treatment for autonomously functioning thyroid nodules (AFTNs) compared to conventional surgery and radioactive iodine (RAI).
results_summary: The review found that RFA is a safe option for treating AFTNs, especially in high-risk surgical candidates or those with contraindications to RAI, though long-term trials (≥5 years) are needed to standardize its use.
population_specificity: Patients with autonomously functioning thyroid nodules (AFTNs), primarily from European and Asian populations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of N-acetylcysteine solution (NAC) versus sodium thiosulfate solution (STS) in relieving symptoms caused by Lugol's iodine chromoendoscopy.
results_summary: NAC was found to be noninferior to STS in neutralizing residual iodine and alleviating mucosal irritation symptoms, with no significant differences in adverse symptoms, retrosternal discomfort, or heart rate variability between the two groups.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing Lugol's iodine chromoendoscopy for esophageal squamous cell carcinoma detection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare mucosal iodine density from DECTE in Crohn disease-affected bowel with histopathologic specimens to assess disease activity.
results_summary: The study compared normalized iodine density from DECTE with histologic inflammation grades but did not explicitly report iodine's therapeutic effects or outcomes.
population_specificity: Adults with Crohn disease who underwent DECTE within 90 days of ileocolectomy or colonoscopy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate how iodine fortification strategies in Benin and Ghana contribute to meeting daily micronutrient intake requirements in women of reproductive age (WRA) and assess the risk of excess intake.
results_summary: Fortification of salt was essential to meet daily iodine requirements in WRA, but the study did not report adverse effects from iodine intake. Excess intake risks were noted for other micronutrients (vitamin A, folic acid, niacin) but not specifically for iodine.
population_specificity: Women of reproductive age (WRA) in Benin and Ghana.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare long-term outcomes of low-dose (1.1 GBq) versus high-dose (3.7 GBq) radioactive iodine ablation in Chinese patients with low/intermediate-risk differentiated thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in long-term outcomes between the two doses, with 98.6% of patients showing an excellent response. Incomplete responses were rare and associated with higher stimulated serum thyroglobulin levels and unsuccessful ablation.
population_specificity: Chinese patients with low/intermediate-risk differentiated thyroid cancer (n=506).
effective_dosage: 1.1 GBq or 3.7 GBq radioactive iodine ablation (single dose).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of iodine versus chlorhexidine in reducing vaginal bacterial counts before hysterectomy.
results_summary: Iodine was less effective than chlorhexidine in reducing bacterial counts at 90 minutes (85.4% positive cultures vs. 47.6%). No adverse reactions or surgical site infections were reported with iodine use.
population_specificity: Women undergoing total hysterectomy via vaginal or laparoscopic approach (average age 59.8 years).
effective_dosage: 10% iodine solution for presurgical vaginal preparation.
study_duration: Single application before surgery, with follow-up swabs at 30, 60, and 90 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to raise awareness among endocrinologists/oncologists about the potential side effect of osteonecrosis of the jaw (ONJ) associated with bisphosphonates and tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs) in thyroid cancer patients.
results_summary: The study highlights the association between ONJ and TKIs, particularly when used with bisphosphonates, emphasizing the need for preventive measures and regular dental examinations to mitigate risk. It underscores the clinical challenge of managing ONJ in patients on TKIs, as discontinuation may lead to disease progression.
population_specificity: Patients with metastatic radio-iodine refractory differentiated thyroid cancer treated with zoledronic acid and sorafenib.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate treatment strategies for Graves' orbitopathy (GO), including the role of radioactive iodine (RAI) and associated therapies.
results_summary: The study highlights that RAI treatment for Graves' disease requires low-dose oral prednisone prophylaxis, especially in the presence of risk factors, to manage GO. It also recommends i.v. methylprednisolone and mycophenolate sodium as first-line treatment for moderate-to-severe GO.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' orbitopathy (GO), particularly those with active moderate-to-severe or sight-threatening cases.
effective_dosage: Cumulative dose of 4.5 g i.v. methylprednisolone in 12 weekly infusions (or up to 8 g in severe cases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the dose parameters and clinical efficacy of 3D-printed template-guided versus traditional CT-guided radioactive iodine seed implantation in gynecological tumor patients.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in most dosimetric parameters between the two groups, except for D80 in the traditional group. The 3D-PT-guided method showed comparable efficacy to the traditional CT-guided approach.
population_specificity: 28 patients with gynecological tumors treated at Hebei General Hospital (2016-2018).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the impact of endocrine disruptor compounds (EDCs) on the thyroid hormone system, including iodine-containing thyroid hormones, and their potential adverse effects across species, including humans.
results_summary: The study highlights that EDCs disrupt thyroid hormone regulation, affecting synthesis, metabolism, and action, with significant risks to human development, especially fetal and neonatal brain development, and broader implications for global health and the environment.
population_specificity: Humans (fetal, neonatal, adult, aging) and various animal species.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if adding a dilute povidone-iodine soak and scrub to a standard skin preparation reduces bacterial culture rates from the hallux nailfold in orthopaedic foot and ankle surgery.
results_summary: The study found no benefit to adding a 3-minute dilute povidone-iodine soak and scrub to the standard alcohol and chlorhexidine skin preparation, as there was no reduction in positive bacterial culture rates.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing orthopaedic foot and ankle surgery (242 subjects completed the study).
effective_dosage: 3-minute dilute povidone-iodine soak and scrub (specific concentration not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to report a rare case of intraparotid recurrence of papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC) and review similar cases in the literature.
results_summary: The study described a case of intraparotid recurrence of PTC in a 71-year-old man, treated with superficial parotidectomy and radioactive iodine therapy, and highlighted the need to consider PTC metastasis in parotid mass diagnoses.
population_specificity: 71-year-old male with a history of PTC.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the role of iodine in the synthesis of thyroid hormones T3 and T4, which are crucial for development, differentiation, and metabolism regulation.
results_summary: The abstract states that iodine is essential for thyroid hormone synthesis and is actively transported into the thyroid, but it does not provide specific study results on iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review novel therapeutic options for treating iodine-resistant thyroid cancer, focusing on recent advancements in molecular-targeted therapies.
results_summary: The study highlights significant progress in treating iodine-resistant thyroid cancer, including FDA-approved tyrosine kinase inhibitors and small molecular inhibitors targeting VEGFR, BRAF, MEK, NTRK, and RET, which improve prognosis and can re-sensitize cancers to radioactive iodine. A notable breakthrough is an FDA-approved treatment for BRAF-mutated anaplastic thyroid cancer, previously considered rapidly fatal.
population_specificity: Patients with iodine-resistant thyroid cancer, particularly those with BRAF-mutated anaplastic thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of topical povidone-iodine as a recommended intervention for chemotherapy-associated paronychia (CAP).
results_summary: The abstract suggests that topical povidone-iodine is among the recommended interventions for CAP, but it does not provide specific efficacy data or comparative results. The focus is on its inclusion as a potential treatment option.
population_specificity: Patients experiencing chemotherapy-associated paronychia (CAP).

study_goal: To evaluate the clinico-pathologic features, treatment options, prognostic factors, and survival outcomes of malignant struma ovarii, focusing on the role of radioactive iodine ablation (RIA).
results_summary: Radioactive iodine ablation (RIA) significantly improved progression-free survival (PFS) compared to no RIA (94.9% vs. 64.8%). Patients who underwent gynecologic surgery followed by thyroidectomy and RIA had higher PFS than those with surgical treatment only (94.5% vs. 64.3%).
population_specificity: Patients with malignant struma ovarii (178 cases reviewed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of long-term antithyroid drug therapy (LTADT) for Graves' disease compared to shorter-term therapy, radioactive iodine, or surgery.
results_summary: LTADT was found to be safe and associated with a higher chance of remission from Graves' disease than shorter-term therapy. It also showed potential benefits in quality of life and clinical outcomes compared to radioiodine and surgery.
population_specificity: Children and young adults with Graves' disease.
effective_dosage: Stable low dose (specific amount not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the biochemical outcomes, toxicity, and health-related quality of life (HRQOL) between single-fraction High-Dose-Rate brachytherapy (HDRB) and Iodine-125 Low-Dose-Rate brachytherapy (LDRB) for prostate cancer treatment.
results_summary: LDRB (Iodine-125) resulted in significantly lower PSA nadir and a higher proportion of patients achieving PSA <0.4 ng/mL compared to HDRB, but HDRB showed superior HRQOL in the irritative urinary domain. No significant differences in late toxicities were observed between the two treatments.
population_specificity: Men with low and favorable intermediate-risk prostate cancer across three centers.
effective_dosage: Iodine-125 LDRB (specific dosage not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the impact of iodine (both deficiency and excess) on thyroid function in preterm infants and its potential role in neurodevelopmental impairment.
results_summary: The study found that iodine levels (deficiency or excess) may affect thyroid function in preterm infants, with mixed results on whether hypothyroxinemia contributes to neurodevelopmental impairment. Some trials in extremely preterm infants (<28 weeks) showed potential benefits.
population_specificity: Preterm and low birth weight (LBW) infants, particularly those born <28 weeks gestation.
interactions: Neonatal drugs (e.g., dopamine) and non-thyroidal illness syndrome (NTIS) may impact thyroid function.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether oral transmucosal absorption of povidone-iodine occurs during intraoral preparation and its effect on thyroxine levels in blood.
results_summary: The study found significant increases in serum and urinary iodine levels after povidone-iodine use, but no corresponding changes in thyroxine levels. Iodine levels remained elevated for several days post-operation.
population_specificity: Healthy male adults aged 20-40 years undergoing oral surgery under general anesthesia.
effective_dosage: Povidone-iodine irrigation of the oral cavity for 3 minutes.
study_duration: Single 3-minute application before surgery, with follow-up measurements up to 3 days post-operation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the management of metastatic struma ovarii, including the use of radioactive iodine therapy and TSH suppression therapy.
results_summary: The study found that most patients with metastatic struma ovarii were treated with pelvic surgery, thyroidectomy, and radioactive iodine therapy, with over half achieving disease-free status at follow-up. TSH suppression therapy was used in less than half of the patients.
population_specificity: 82-year-old patient with malignant struma ovarii and liver metastasis, plus 43 additional cases from literature review.
study_duration: Mean follow-up after metastasis diagnosis was 3.6 years (range 0.5–24 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of dual-energy CT in improving the diagnosis of acute bowel ischemia by enhancing visualization of iodine contrast in bowel wall and mesenteric vasculature.
results_summary: Dual-energy CT improved detection of subtle bowel wall enhancement and intramural hemorrhage, provided CT angiography-like images from portal venous phase scans, and potentially reduced intravenous contrast dose.
population_specificity: Patients with suspected acute bowel ischemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the analgesic efficacy, safety, and local tumor control of iodine-125.
results_summary: Significant improvement in pain was noted at 4- and 24-week follow-ups (p < 0.01). Studies combining iodine-125 with other treatments showed enhanced outcomes.
population_specificity: 689 patients with tumors (details unspecified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if the number of metastatic lymph nodes could guide radioactive iodine (RAI) dose selection to reduce recurrence in papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC) patients.
results_summary: High-dose RAI (≥3.7 GBq) significantly lowered recurrence rates in patients with >5 metastatic lymph nodes, while extrathyroidal extension was linked to recurrence in those with ≤5 metastatic nodes.
population_specificity: 595 PTC patients post-thyroidectomy with no evidence of disease at treatment assessment.
effective_dosage: Low-dose (1.11 GBq) vs. high-dose (≥3.7 GBq) RAI.
study_duration: Follow-up period not specified in abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and dosimetry outcomes of 3D print template-assisted iodine seed implantation versus traditional free-hand implantation.
results_summary: The study found that 3D print template-assisted implantation improved dosimetry outcomes (D90, D100, V90, V100) and reduced operation time compared to free-hand implantation, with no significant differences in organ-at-risk doses between 3DPNCT and 3DPCT groups.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing iodine seed implantation (specific condition not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evidence behind treating asymptomatic carriers of tinea capitis, including the efficacy of povidone-iodine among other treatments.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine showed significant effects in the mycological eradication of fungal conidia, but the overall evidence for treating asymptomatic carriage was sparse and of low to moderate quality. Topical agents like povidone-iodine were preferable due to fewer adverse effects compared to systemic treatments.
population_specificity: Asymptomatic carriers of tinea capitis, primarily children from developing countries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the mechanisms, clinical effects, and management strategies of radioactive iodine (RAI)-induced sialadenitis in patients treated for differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).
results_summary: High RAI concentration in salivary glands causes acute/chronic sialadenitis, leading to obstructive symptoms, loss of function, and xerostomia. Prevention methods like sialogogues are recommended, but no standard diagnostic or treatment protocol exists.
population_specificity: Patients receiving RAI treatment for differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the successful ablation rate after radioiodine (RAI) administration in patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) at intermediate-high risk of recurrence.
results_summary: The study found a pooled successful ablation rate of 71%, higher in intermediate-risk (72%) than high-risk (52%) patients. Recurrence rates were significantly lower (2%) in intermediate-risk patients with successful ablation compared to those without (14%).
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) at intermediate-high risk of recurrence (n=3103).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare reference intervals (RIs) for TSH between different ethnic groups (Yellows and Caucasians) and assess the impact of iodine status on these intervals.
results_summary: The study found that Yellows have higher TSH reference intervals than Caucasians, with wider ranges in disease-free populations. The meta-analysis confirmed these ethnic differences in both reference and disease-free populations.
population_specificity: Disease-free and reference populations in mainland China and online databases, focusing on ethnic comparisons (Yellows vs. Caucasians).

study_goal: To investigate the effect of iodine supplementation during gestation on the neurocognitive development of children in iodine-deficient areas.
results_summary: Iodine supplementation (up to 300 μg/day) did not significantly improve mental or behavioral development indices but showed improvement in psychomotor development, particularly in gross motor skills, and differences in response time to sound in mild deficiency areas.
population_specificity: Pregnant women and their children in mild to moderate iodine-deficient areas.
effective_dosage: Maximum 300 μg of potassium iodide per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether intraoperative wound irrigation with aqueous 10% povidone-iodine (PVP-I) solution is superior to saline in reducing surgical site infections (SSIs) after elective gastrointestinal surgery.
results_summary: The study hypothesizes that PVP-I irrigation will achieve a 50% reduction in SSI incidence compared to saline, with the primary outcome being SSI incidence up to postoperative day 30. Results are pending as the trial is ongoing.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing elective gastrointestinal surgery with clean-contaminated wounds.
effective_dosage: 40 mL of aqueous 10% PVP-I solution applied for 1 minute before skin suture.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and limitations of iodine (povidone-iodine) as an irrigation additive for treating periprosthetic joint infections (PJIs).
results_summary: The study found that iodine may play a role in treating PJI, but definitive clinical studies comparing antiseptic irrigation to no antiseptic irrigation are lacking, and no optimal irrigation solution has been identified.
population_specificity: Patients with acute or chronic periprosthetic joint infections (PJIs).

study_goal: To determine the optimal trigger threshold for dual-energy CT angiography (DECTA) with reduced iodine dose and assess its feasibility in human participants.
results_summary: The study found that using an optimized threshold (30 HU at 40 keV) in DECTA allowed a 50% reduction in iodine dose (300 mg/kg) while maintaining diagnostic quality, compared to conventional single-energy CT angiography (600 mg/kg). The median iodine dose was significantly lower in the optimized DECTA group (13 g) versus conventional DECTA (19 g) and SECTA (26 g) groups.
population_specificity: 96 participants (mean age 72 ± 9 years; 80 men) undergoing whole-body CT angiography.
effective_dosage: 300 mg of iodine per kilogram (reduced dose) vs. 600 mg of iodine per kilogram (standard dose).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the performance, safety, and cost-effectiveness of tantalum oxide-based nanoparticles (TaOx NPs) with commercially available iodine-based contrast agents for computed tomography.
results_summary: The study found that TaOx NPs outperformed iodine-based contrast agents in terms of contrast performance, long-circulation, and safety profiles, with reduced X-ray exposure and dosage requirements. Iodine-based agents were implied to have inferior properties compared to TaOx NPs.
population_specificity: Not specified (general comparison of contrast agents)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the physiological mechanisms during pregnancy that could lead to Gestational Hypothyroidism (GHT), including the role of iodine clearance and thyroid hormone regulation.
results_summary: The study found that increased renal iodine clearance during pregnancy may contribute to a low iodine state, potentially leading to GHT. However, levothyroxine treatment for GHT showed no neurodevelopmental improvement in offspring, raising questions about its efficacy.
population_specificity: Pregnant women, particularly those at risk for or diagnosed with Gestational Hypothyroidism.

study_goal: The researchers reviewed therapeutic uses of radioactive iodine-125 in brachytherapy and radioactive seed localization for prostate, cervical, and breast cancer.
results_summary: The study found that image-guided brachytherapy using iodine-125 is a promising alternative or addition to external beam radiation or surgery for prostate and cervical cancer, while radioactive seed localization improves accuracy and patient satisfaction in breast cancer surgery.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate, cervical, and breast cancer.

study_goal: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of a single administration of 5% povidone-iodine (PVP-I) compared to artificial tears for treating adenoviral conjunctivitis.
results_summary: A single dose of 5% PVP-I significantly reduced viral load and improved clinical signs and symptoms by day 4 compared to artificial tears, with no differences observed after day 4.
population_specificity: Adults (≥18 years) with early-stage adenoviral conjunctivitis and a positive AdenoPlus test.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the mechanisms regulating NIS transport to the cell membrane and assess the current status of redifferentiation therapy for patients with RAI-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (RAIR-DTC).
results_summary: The study found that differentiated thyroid tumors often exhibit reduced iodide conveyance and abnormal NIS retention, but various methods are being tested to improve NIS transport and iodine absorption, potentially enhancing RAI therapy efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), particularly those with RAI-refractory (RAIR) cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of iodine in sialo-CBCT for assessing salivary gland function and diagnosing various salivary gland disorders.
results_summary: The study found that iodine clearance in post-evacuation images is critical for functional evaluation in sialo-CBCT. Iodine-related findings were similar to obstructive sialadenitis in cases of radioactive-iodine-induced damage, with atrophy in late stages.
